events.name: V. Psychology Days
events.description:

- Workshops within the event have limited capacity.

- It is possible to attend only the speaking sessions by not participating in the workshops. Participants who wish to attend the workshops must select the workshop they wish to attend.

- Our event is chargeable, and the fees are as follows.

Attendance fee for all two days of speeches = 100₺

In addition to attending all two days of speeches, attendance fee for one workshop = 150₺

events.name: Advanced Counseling Skills
events.description:
We are excited to introduce a brand new program to you! 🤗

'Advanced Counseling Skills' is a highly transformative program that we have been eager to share with you for many years. We believe it is extremely impactful for therapy rooms and therapist-client relationships, and it will elevate counseling skills to the next level.

Covering a wide range of topics from effective communication skills, a fundamental principle of psychotherapy, to the dynamics of therapy processes, the program will be led by Expert Clinical Psychologist Ayşegül Kalem, who has made significant contributions to this field for years, and presented by the world-renowned psychologist Prof. Jeffrey A. Kottler, with guidance from the experts at Psychology Istanbul and YENİ Psychology. Throughout the training, you will enhance your advanced counseling skills through a comprehensive manual, practical exercises, case examples, and interactive learning.

events.name: Schema Therapy Practitioner Training
events.description:
🗓️ June 1-2-22-23, 2024
🔸 32 Hours Online Training
🔸 8 Hours Online Supervision
🔸 Opportunity to Review Lessons
🔸 University-approved certificate visible on E-Government
🔸 Free Materials
🔸 Limited Capacity, High-Yield Training

✅ Schema therapy, developed by Young and colleagues, is an integrative and relatively newer type of therapy that combines elements of cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), psychoanalysis, attachment theory, and emotion-focused therapy. It aims to treat personality disorders and other psychiatric disorders that do not respond to other treatment options. As it is known, resolving characterological problems with classical cognitive-behavioral therapy is quite challenging. In Schema Therapy, the goal is to identify early maladaptive schemas stemming from unmet basic needs in early childhood and raise awareness in the patient about them. Treatment approaches in Schema Therapy often progress not through schemas themselves but through the 'mode concept,' which involves the combination of activated schemas and coping styles.
